page.title: 01Middle River Font Valley
page.content: Dominant feature of southern area is River Font flowing W to E its steep banks thickly wooded with deciduous trees and mostly inaccessable. Land rises from River Gorge to 180m in the north. Several streams flow south to river. Land use is entirely agricultural mostly sheep farming with some beef cattle. Crops grown are barley, wheat, oil seed rape, hay & silage. Total population is approximately 80 including 15 under 18 years old and 14 retired persons. Fourteen people travel daily out of the area for work, all using their own transport. There are 9 working and occupied farms and one small market garden. The standard of housing is generally high most have mains water and telephones and all have electricity. There is no public transport. Schools, places of worship
